result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah K. Ditusa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to victim due within 30 days and must be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Mariah K. Ditusa in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty places agreement on record to amended charge of disorderly conduct. DE enters plea of no contest. Plea colloquy.  Plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Court finds DE guilty.  Court orders sentenced withheld; 9 months probation; court costs; DNA surcharge; letter of apology to victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; any other counseling deemed appropriate. ba
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Mariah K. Ditusa in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Bond continued.  - rt

Defendant Mariah K. Ditusa in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 signature bond and booking.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond and booking.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is April 7, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.   - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
